content: If a car travels at an average speed of 50 miles per hour, how long will it take to cover a distance of 300 miles?

To determine how long it will take for a car traveling at an average speed of 50 miles per hour to cover a distance of 300 miles, we can use the formula for time, which is:

\[ \text{Time} = \frac{\text{Distance}}{\text{Speed}} \]

Given:

- Distance = 300 miles

- Speed = 50 miles per hour

Plugging these values into the formula:

\[ \text{Time} = \frac{300 \text{ miles}}{50 \text{ miles per hour}} = 6 \text{ hours} \]

Therefore, it will take 6 hours to cover a distance of 300 miles at an average speed of 50 miles per hour.
